basics.name: Sarah Amiraslani
basics.label: Data Scientist | Quantitative Analyst | Developer Relations Specialist
basics.summary: Driven Data Science and Analytics professional with a passion for solving complex problems.

work.name: Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.
work.summary: As the lead technical contributor to the AI/ML developer relations program, I drove a 60% boost in model development efficiency and a 150% increase in AI/ML tooling adoption. I enhanced collaboration across internal business units and with vendors on diverse use cases. Through strategic coordination, I reduced model time-to-market by 20% and generated $1 million in value, significantly elevating our program's visibility company-wide.

work.name: Changing Room, INC.
work.summary: I engineered data mining and ETL pipelines, developing Python programs to scrape terabytes of fast-fashion brand data and optimize its storage for machine learning. Collaborating with model developers and UX engineers, I created an AI-driven recommendation system, deployed as a Chrome plugin, to promote sustainable and ethical shopping choices.

work.name: Trackonomy Systems, INC.
work.summary: Engineered a Python-based computer vision system for manufacturing quality control, reducing annual material waste by $115,000 and boosting production efficiency by 65%. Collaborated with engineering and operations teams to implement a real-time analytics pipeline, enabling proactive issue detection and cutting downtime by 40%.

work.name: University of California, San Diego
work.summary: Lead office hours and tutoring sessions for undergraduate cognitive science majors learning Python programming and data science, earning high ratings from students for clarity and support.

work.name: University of California, San Diego
work.summary: Conducted independent research on cognitive behavioral neuroscience, focusing on experimental design, data analysis, and visualization for my thesis project. For more details, visit my thesis page.

work.name: University of California, San Diego - School of Medicine
work.summary: Assisted in research projects focusing on archival data analysis, data visualization, and statistical analysis.

education.thesis: Understanding the in-situ Solar Wind Properties with Machine Learning

education.score: GPA 3.9/4.0, Magna Cum Laude with Honors
education.thesis: Drawing to Learn Abstract Science Concepts

awards.title: Norman Henry Anderson Excellence in Research
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence in research among my cohort of honors students.

awards.title: Departmental Honors
awards.summary: Received honors for completing an independent research project. Following two years of research experiments, my thesis investigated the use of drawing as a tool in STEM education to learn abstract concepts that lack a definitive form.

awards.title: Chancellor's Undergraduate Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Granted for exceptional undergraduate research conducted in the Psychiatry department. My project explored the relationship between adverse life events and disordered eating behaviors among young girls in the juvenile justice system.
